page.title: 16LEISURE TIME - CHELTENHAM
page.content: {TOWN HALL.}A location for the taking of the waters, centre for Cheltenham's International Music Festival and Literary and Drama Festivals. Venue for many local exhibitions and events, including a revival of weekly Tea Dances,popular{recreation} of over 50's. { CENTRAL LIBRARY.}Built in 1887, once an Art School. Facilities for borrowing fiction, non-fiction and childrens' books; records for all musical tastes and an excellent Schools Museum Service. { HOLST MUSEUM.}Gustav Holst, 20th Century composer, lived as a small boy at 4, Clarence Road. The house is preserved as a museum and school parties visiting can be taken back in time to the Victorian era of Holst's childhood. Most famous work of Holst is "The Planet Suite".
